keyword: how many calories are in brownies
title: How Many Calories Are in Brownies?
meta_description: Learn how many calories are in brownies with a full nutrition breakdown per serving, including carbs, protein, fat, and tips for variations.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Brownies?
assumptions: Standard chocolate brownie, approximately 50 g each, baked with flour, sugar, butter, eggs, and cocoa; no nuts or frosting.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, brand, size, ingredients, and baking method. Check labels for packaged brownies.

quick_answer.text: A typical brownie contains about 220 calories and 30 g of carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1/4 cup chopped walnuts per batch (adds ~20 kcal per brownie)
Use low-fat butter substitute (reduces ~30 kcal per brownie)
Frost with chocolate icing (adds ~50 kcal per brownie)

faqs.q: How many calories are in one brownie?
faqs.a: About 220 kcal for a standard 50 g chocolate brownie.
Yes, typically 20 g of sugars per brownie from added sugar and chocolate.

faqs.q: How much fat is in brownies?
faqs.a: Around 11 g total fat per brownie, with 3 g saturated.
A small amount, about 2 g per brownie from eggs and flour.

faqs.q: How do calories in brownies vary?
faqs.a: Depends on size and ingredientsâ€”homemade can differ from store-bought; nuts or frosting add more calories.
